articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Hamas leader Ismail Haniyeh was killed in Iran on Wednesday, the Palestinian militant group Hamas and Iran's elite Revolutionary Guards said in separate statements.
articles.title: Hamas chief Ismail Haniyeh killed in Iran, Hamas says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah said early on Wednesday its senior commander Fuad Shukr was in the building in the southern suburbs of Beirut targeted by an Israeli strike, but it did not confirm his fate.
articles.title: Hezbollah says top commander was in building targeted by Israeli strike, fate unknown

articles.author: Samia Nakhoul, Stephen Farrell
articles.description: Ismail Haniyeh, the Hamas leader who was killed in Iran, was the tough-talking face of the Palestinian group's international diplomacy as war raged back in Gaza, where three of his sons were killed in an Israeli airstrike.
articles.title: Tough-talking Haniyeh was seen as the more moderate face of Hamas

articles.author: Mircely Guanipa, Tibisay Romero
articles.description: Stores were closed and buses not running around much of Venezuela on Wednesday, as tensions over a disputed presidential election and rumors of opposition arrests kept many people home.
articles.title: Venezuela shops shuttered, transport limited amid fears of more opposition arrests

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia launched several waves of drones on Kyiv in what was one of the war's largest attacks of its kind targeting Ukraine, the military administration of the city said on Wednesday, keeping the Ukrainian capital under air raid alerts nearly all night.
articles.title: Russia launches one of war's largest drone attacks on Ukraine, Kyiv's military says

articles.author: Temilade Adelaja
articles.description: A 17-year-old male is in custody on suspicion of murder and attempted murder after the rampage at a "Taylor Swift yoga and dance workshop", a summer-vacation event for children aged 6 to 11.
articles.title: Girls' killings in Southport spur violence, police ready for more clashes

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Myanmar's embattled military government extended a state of emergency on Wednesday for another six months, state media said, as the junta struggles to maintain its grip on power with fighting flaring on multiple fronts and the economy in crisis.
articles.title: Myanmar junta extends emergency rule amid escalating conflict

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vladimir Kara-Murza, a dual Russian-British national jailed on treason charges for 25 years, has been moved from his prison in Siberia and is being sent elsewhere, Russia's prison service told Reuters.
articles.title: Russian-UK dissident Kara-Murza disappears from jail in latest sign a prisoner swap with West may be close

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Qatar's flagship Al Jazeera TV said on Wednesday that its reporter Ismail al-Ghoul and cameraman Ramy El Rify were killed in an Israeli strike on Gaza City.
articles.title: Al Jazeera says reporter, cameraman killed in Israel strike on Gaza

articles.author: Sam Tobin
articles.description: Former BBC TV news presenter Huw Edwards, a household name in Britain, pleaded guilty on Wednesday to three counts of making indecent pictures of children.
articles.title: Ex-BBC news presenter Huw Edwards pleads guilty to indecent child pictures charges
